name: Layered Beef Salad with Warm Dressing
author: tj_clark
summary: This dish is quick, tasty, and my favorite! The cold salad and warm steak are the perfect combination in this dish! You can make the salad any way you want. I add jicama for the crunch!
ingredients: 1 (1 1/2) pound beef sirloin steak, sliced thinly across the grain
2 heads red leaf lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
1 bunch radishes, sliced into thin rounds
directions: Whisk together the soy sauce, sukiyaki sauce, water, ginger, and garlic in a small bowl
Arrange the sliced steak in the bottom of a shallow baking dish
Pour about 1/2 of the soy sauce mixture over the steak
Build the salad by layering onto a platter the lettuce, onion, radish, cucumber, tomato, jicama, and eggs in that order
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Cook the marinated steak strips in the hot oil to desired doneness, 3 minutes each side for medium-well
